title: UN report finds widespread sexual violence in Sri Lanka’s civil war
byline: A new United Nations report about sexual violence related to Sri Lanka’s civil war is another step forward in the struggle for accountability for crimes under international law that were committed in Sri Lanka, Human Rights Watch said today.

title: Digital learning should be safe and fair for all students: Minister
byline: Prime Minister and Minister of Education Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said it is important to reduce the gap in digital facilities between schools and to make sure that technology in education is safe for children.

title: Mainly fair weather expected during the day
byline: The Meteorology Department said the prevailing showery conditions over the island are likely to ease from today (15), bringing relatively stable weather to most regions.

title: Port City Colombo lands US $ 300mn investment as phase II moves ahead
byline: Port City Colombo has secured a US $ 300 million foreign direct investment (FDI) commitment from its primary developer, clearing the way for phase II of the flagship reclamation project and delivering an early boost to Sri Lanka’s efforts to revive the long-term capital inflows.

title: Top legal expert urges govt. to consult private sector on proposed EPF pension scheme
byline: A leading corporate legal expert has urged the government to engage in meaningful consultation with the private sector, including the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce, before proceeding with the proposed conversion of the Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF) into a pension scheme.

title: Tea sector steadies as full-year output rises despite December drop
byline: Sri Lanka’s tea output weakened slightly in December 2025 from a year earlier.

title: Thai Pongal, an invitation to embark upon new journey towards future with courage, confidence: President
byline: Symbolising prosperity and thankfulness, Thai Pongal is not merely a celebration of a bountiful harvest, but also an invitation to embark upon a new journey towards the future with courage and confidence, Present Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: FAO seeks USD 16.5m to aid Sri Lanka
byline: The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) has appealed for USD 16.5 million in international assistance to support the early recovery of livelihoods and food security for communities devastated by Cyclone Ditwah in Sri Lanka.

title: Welisara court fines three traders Rs. 300,000 for overpricing rice
byline: The Welisara Magistrate’s Court has fined three traders in the Gampaha district a total of Rs. 300,000 for selling rice above the government’s maximum retail price, after they pleaded guilty to the charges filed by the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA). The ruling was delivered yesterday (14).

title: Detainee dies after falling ill while in court cell
byline: A detainee who was being held in a court cell while awaiting production before the Hingurakgoda Magistrate’s Court died after falling ill and being admitted to hospital, police said.

title: UK couple donates £2,000 to ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ fund
byline: A British couple residing near the Sri Lanka High Commission in the United Kingdom has donated £2,000 to the Government’s ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund to assist communities affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: U.S. transfers 10 TH-57 helicopters to Sri Lanka Air Force
byline: The United States has transferred ten TH-57 (Bell 206) helicopters to the Sri Lanka Air Force on January 7, strengthening the country’s aerial capabilities in pilot training, disaster response, and emergency operations.

title: Strict action on local fishermen as Indian fishing issue persists
byline: While authorities are yet to find a lasting solution to illegal fishing and repeated incursions into Sri Lankan territorial waters by Indian fishermen, the Department of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources (DFAR) has taken strict action against local fishermen engaged in illegal fishing practices and the deliberate tampering of Vessel Monitoring Systems (VMS).

title: Environment Ministry to look into Chinese company pulling out of Ambuluwawa Cable Car Project
byline: Claiming that he was concerned after the China-based Amber Adventures (Private) Limited pulling out of the Ambuluwawa Cable Car Project, Environment Minister Dammika Patabedi said yesterday he instructed the Ministry to look into the matter, saying that the government is not at all keen on any investors leaving the country.

title: Drug usage among rich and elite rises in Sri Lanka
byline: In a worrying twist to Sri Lanka’s ongoing battle against narcotics, recent data and law enforcement reports reveal a notable increase in drug use among affluent communities and high-socioeconomic groups in districts across Sri Lanka, a trend that has alarmed policymakers and the law enforcement officers alike.

title: Iran warns of retaliation if Trump strikes, US withdraws some personnel from bases
byline: The United States is withdrawing some personnel from bases in the Middle East, a U.S. official said on Wednesday, after a senior Iranian official said Tehran had warned neighbours it would hit American bases if Washington strikes.

title: We bear collective responsibility of steering country towards “new era of revival’’: PM
byline: The government bears the collective responsibility of steering the country towards a “new era of revival’’ by bringing about a transformation in attitudes through policy and structural reforms, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said.

title: US freezes all visa processing for 75 countries, including Somalia, Russia, Iran
byline: The State Department is pausing immigrant visa processing for 75 countries in an effort to crack down on applicants deemed likely to become a public charge.

title: Protestor climbs electric pole at Galle Face alleging police injustice
byline: A person launched a protest by climbing an electric pole along Galle Face Centre Road, claiming that he has been treated unfairly by the Kelaniya Police.

title: Four space station crewmates, one ailing, begin emergency return flight
byline: A SpaceX capsule departed the International Space Station on Wednesday carrying a four-member crew on an emergency return flight to Earth necessitated by an undisclosed serious medical condition afflicting one of the astronauts aboard.

title: Rain expected after 4 p.m. in four districts
byline: The Meteorological Department has forecast showers or thundershowers in a few areas of Kalutara, Galle, Matara, and Rathnapura districts after 4:00 p.m. today.

title: Academics call on Government to safeguard credibility of education reforms amid online attacks on PM
byline: A group of academics, professionals, and social activists have issued a joint statement urging the government to preserve the integrity of ongoing education reforms, warning that recent online attacks against the Prime Minister and Minister of Education, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, risk undermining a transformative agenda for the country’s education system.

title: X to stop Grok AI from undressing images of real people after backlash
byline: Elon Musk’s AI model Grok will no longer be able to edit photos of real people to show them in revealing clothing in jurisdictions where it is illegal, after widespread concern over sexualised AI deepfakes.

title: CAA raids Beruwala filling station for selling Euro 3 instead of 92 petrol
byline: A filling station in Beruwala was raided last night (14) after the Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) received reports that some fuel stations were selling Euro 3 petrol at higher prices at night while claiming that 92 petrol was unavailable.

title: SPC’s contribution to government rises by 173 percent compared to 2024: Health Ministry
byline: The State Pharmaceuticals Corporation of Sri Lanka (SPC) has contributed Rs. 1.118 billion to the government through income tax and treasury levies in 2025, which is an increase by 173 percent compared to 2024, the Health Ministry said.

title: Fire breaks out at shop in Maligawatta
byline: A fire has erupted at a shop in Maligawatta, prompting an urgent response from local authorities.

title: New luxury tourism bus ‘Bustaurant’ launched in Dambulla
byline: A new tourism venture called “Bustaurant,” offering all the facilities of a luxury bus, was launched today (15) to provide a unique travel experience for local and foreign tourists.

title: Veteran singer Raju Bandara passes away
byline: Veteran singer and musician Raju Bandara passed away today at the age of 65, family sources confirmed in Colombo. His death marks the end of a career defined by his soulful contributions to Sri Lanka’s music industry.

title: Astronauts splash down to Earth after medical evacuation from space station
byline: Four astronauts evacuated from the International Space Station (ISS) have landed back on Earth after their stay in space was cut short by a month due to a ’’serious’’ medical issue.

title: Singapore company donates USD 10,000 to ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ fund
byline: A Singapore-registered company and supplier to the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has contributed USD 10,000 (approximately LKR 30 million) to the Government’s ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund to support relief efforts for those affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Cancer Radiation treatment at Galle hospital comes to a standstill
byline: Radiation treatment for cancer patients at the Galle National Hospital has been halted owing to the breakdown of both radiation therapy machines at the facility.

title: Work on Kasikote elephant tunnel to resume on January 19
byline: Work on the Kasikote Elephant Tunnel project is set to resume on January 19, following a comprehensive review of the existing structure and its impact.

title: President launches 50MW wind power project in Mannar
byline: In line with the government’s policy to achieve net zero carbon emissions by 2050, a 50-megawatt wind power project in Mannar was officially launched this morning (15) under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Sri Lanka exceeds renewable energy targets: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka has made significant progress in expanding its renewable energy capacity and has already surpassed several national targets, Minister of Energy Kumara Jayakody revealed yesterday.

title: President commissions 20MW windscape Mannar power plant
byline: The 20-megawatt ‘Windscape Mannar’ wind power plant, constructed by CEYLEX Renewables in Mannar, was officially connected to the national grid this morning under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: CTU says Govt. ignored guidelines on education reforms
byline: The Ceylon Teachers Union (CTU) has criticized the government for attempting to implement proposed education reforms without following proper guidelines or consulting key stakeholders.

title: Western Province Private Bus Owners threaten strike
byline: Private bus owners in the Western Province are preparing to launch a strike in protest against the actions of the Western Road Passenger Transport Authority (WRPTA).

title: Turkish Airlines flight makes emergency landing in Barcelona after ’threat’ alert
byline: A Turkish Airlines flight made an emergency landing Thursday at Barcelona’s El Prat Airport after a passenger created an in-flight wireless network whose name contained a bomb threat, an airlines spokesperson said.
